linkable_points: All new or replacement septic systems require mandatory prior written approval from Miami-Dade DERM Director before construction begins, making permit approval essential first step in installation process

Septic permit application in Miami-Dade typically costs $500-$2,000 in permit fees depending on system type, property use, and application complexity, with additional costs for site evaluation, design, and engineering services

Permit application requires scaled site plan showing structures, property lines, setbacks, system location, soil evaluation report, OSTDS design specifications conforming to Chapter 62-6, and professional engineer credentials
DERM review and approval process typically takes 4-8 weeks after complete application submission, though timeline varies based on application completeness, site complexity, and DERM workload

Required documentation includes DEP4015 application forms, sewer capacity certification from DRER, site plan with property boundaries and setbacks, system design plans, proof of property ownership, and contractor licensing information

Effective January 1, 2023, Miami-Dade County prohibits conventional Type 1 septic systems for new installations, requiring permit applications to specify Type 2, Type 3, or Type 4 systems based on property location and environmental sensitivity

After permit approval, contractors must schedule and pass inspections by Miami-Dade County Department of Health and building department before backfill and site restoration, with system becoming operational only after final inspection approval

Professional permit application ensures compliance with Miami-Dade County regulations, proper documentation submission, timely approval processing, environmental protection compliance, and successful system installation
